messages.messageBody:
-=That's fined.-=-

I meant "that's fine." Sorry.

We don't have fines on this list, just that trap door.

Sandra

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] For Ruby/Julie
messages.msgSnippet: I would not have let this post through to the list.  When I went to return it to the author, someone had already approved it.  That s fined.  It gives me an
messages.messageBody:
I would not have let this post through to the list. When I went to
return it to the author, someone had already approved it. That's
fined. It gives me an opportunity to point out the problems.

The subject line, "Subject: [AlwaysLearning] For Ruby/Julie" is
inappropriate.
Address comments to the group as a whole as much as you can, even
within posts.

Do NOT advise posters who were here before you were about how to
block your posts. We have kept a lot of peace on this list for
years. We're letting you disrupt that peace for a while because
others benefit from the exchange.

-=-If you're uninterested, don't read. If you disagree, feel free to
do so. I'd actually love to hear your perspective.-=-
The list isn't about what you would love to hear. If you would love
to read about unschooling, stick around.

-=-Oh, and you forgot to say "1 2 3 4, I declare a flame-war".

Next time,

kim k-=-

If you want to stick around, if you want there to be a next time, do
not attempt to post anything this immature and inflammatory again.

-=-http://groups.yahoo.com/group/AlwaysLearning/-=-

If there's anything about "be nice" or "trapdoor" that you don't
understand, don't post anything else until you've figured that out.

Sandra Dodd, listowner

messages.subject: For Ruby/Julie
messages.msgSnippet: I haven t counted, but I d guess that *maybe* 20 people have participated thread to which you refer, between comments I received on-list and off-list. There
messages.messageBody:
I haven't counted, but I'd guess that *maybe* 20
people have participated thread to which you refer,
between comments I received on-list and off-list.
There are how many people subscribed?!? I would guess
that there are plenty of people who're just
uninterested (or bored-to-drooling with my prose as
the case may be). They've managed to not get upset by
it all. You can do the same. Here's how (***note:
practical information ahead***)

If you're uninterested, don't read. If you disagree,
feel free to do so. I'd actually love to hear your
perspective.

I doubt that I'm wasting your bandwidth, because we
all have that in spades now. This is not required
reading.

If you'd like I can send you step-by-step instructions
on setting up a specific filter so that you never have
to chance reading another word I write. Or you can hit
*delete*, both are equally effective.

Oh, and you forgot to say "1 2 3 4, I declare a
flame-war".
Next time,
kim k
